{"step_by_step_thinking": "Primary prevention refers to measures taken to prevent diseases before they occur. Secondary prevention refers to measures that lead to early diagnosis and prompt treatment of a disease, illness or injury to prevent more severe problems developing. Tertiary prevention refers to measures aimed at rehabilitation following significant illness. Primordial prevention involves the prevention of risk factors themselves, before they start causing disease.
